text: summer corn is so sweet you could
practically eat it for dessert all by
itself of course it's even better if you
add cream and sugar the first thing you
need is some sweet summer corn and then
you need to take the kernels off I have
an easy way to do it that doesn't give
you kernels flying all over your kitchen
you start with a corn laid down flat on
the cutting board and you slice it off
like this just right across once you've
created a little flat surface you roll
it over on that and the corn is gonna
stay steady and then you just go around
and slice it off to get the corn flavor
into the ice cream you need to infuse it
into a custard so you're going to take
your kernels throw them in a pot and I'm
also gonna use the corn cobs because
there's a ton of flavor in these I'm
using four corn cobs and this is going
to make about a quart of ice cream and
then I'm gonna add my heavy cream some
whole milk and some of the sugar that
I'm gonna use I'm gonna add a little
more sugar later I'm gonna bring this to
a simmer I'm gonna let this sit and
infuse for about an hour that's when you
want to make the custard take your egg
yolks mix them with a little bit of
sugar and a little bit of salt and just
whisk it together salt just brings out
the flavor of all the other ingredients
it's not gonna taste salty so I've got
six egg yolks here and a quarter cup of
sugar after the corn mixture has infused
for about an hour you can taste it it
should taste really corny at that point
you just want to pull out the corn cobs
and then puree everything else bring the
pureed corn to a simmer then you want to
turn off the heat you want to add about
a cup or so of the hot corn mixture to
the egg yolks stirring constantly so
they don't curdle add the egg yolk
mixture back into the saucepan and then
cook until the custard thickens enough
to coat the spoon it takes about ten
minutes now you want to strain out the
corn kernels I mean they've already
given up their flavor and you don't
really want to chew on them so we want a
nice smooth silky ice cream just work a
little at a time and just press down
so that we can get all the flavor out
I'm gonna add just a little bit of sour
cream to the custard the sour cream is
really tangy and it goes really well
with a sweet corn you want to get this
really cold before you try to freeze it
in an ice cream maker in fact you could
even make this a couple of days ahead
stick it in your fridge and then when
you're ready to make ice cream just pull
it out it'll be there for you so this is
all set it's frozen and now I'm just
going to scoop some out and put a little
blackberry sauce on the top
sweet corn ice cream with blackberry
syrup who knows this could be a whole
new way to enjoy summer corn
